Field.Label: Hue Device:
Select the Hue device whose current settings you'd like to save to a Preset. The settings can be restored to any compatible Hue device at a later time.
Preset:

Select the Preset in which the above device's current settings should be stored. Presets with an asterisk (*) next to them have data already saved in them. Selecting one of these Presets will overwrite the data saved in that Preset.
Preset Name:
Optionally assign a name to this Preset.
Ramp Rate:
(0 - 540 seconds) 0 = instant Save a Ramp Rate (transition time) to be used when recalling this Preset, accurate to 0.1 seconds.
Hue Device:
Select the Hue device to which the Preset should be applied.
Preset:
Select the Preset that should be applied to the device. Presets with an asterisk (*) next to them have data saved in them.
Ramp Rate:
(0 - 540 seconds) 0 = instant Optionally override this Preset's saved Ramp Rate (transition time). This overrides the device's default rate as well. Ramp Rates are accurate to 0.1 seconds.

Field.Label: Scene:
Some Scenes may have the same name because of how the Hue app creates them on the GW. Use the Lights Affected list below to distinguish between Scenes with the same name.

Field.tooltip: The Hue bridge allows you to limit a Scene to just one Group, as long as at least one light in the Scene is part of the Group. Lights that are part of a Scene but NOT part of the selected Group Limit will not be affected.
Field.Label: Group Limit:
Limit the Scene to a specific Hue Group.

Field.tooltip: This list shows all the lights that will be affected by the combination of Scene and Group Limit selections above. These cannot be edited.
Field.Label: Lights Affected:
This list shows which lights are affected by the Scene and Group Limit selections above. This cannot be edited.
